description: Anyswap bridge's anySwapOutUnderlyingWithPermit function had incomplete validation of EIP-2612 permit signatures. The function proceeded with token transfers even when permit validation failed, allowing attackers to bridge tokens without proper authorization.

functions.name: anySwapOutUnderlyingWithPermit
functions.vulnerability: Proceeds with transfers even when permit validation fails

attack_scenario: 1) Attacker called anySwapOutUnderlyingWithPermit with victim's token address. 2) Passed invalid permit signature (v=0, r=0, s=0). 3) Permit validation failed silently. 4) Function continued executing anyway. 5) Tokens were burned/locked and bridged to destination chain. 6) Repeated to drain $8M worth of WETH and other tokens.
root_cause: The permit validation used try-catch that swallowed failures without reverting. The function proceeded with token operations regardless of whether the permit succeeded, effectively bypassing authorization checks entirely.
